snippet: Dan Merzel is scheduled to umpire 142 minor league games in a 152-day stretch and be paid $3,000 a month. But he says it is worth it as he pursues his goal to be an umpire in the major leagues.
abstract: Profile of Dan Merzel, who is working toward his goal to become an umpire in Major League Baseball; Merzel is scheduled to umpire 142 minor league games in a 152-day stretch and be paid $3,000 a month; says it is worth it, even though as a Johns Hopkins graduate with a sought-after degree, he would seem to have more lucrative options.
lead_paragraph: Dan Merzel is scheduled to umpire 142 minor league games in a 152-day stretch and be paid $3,000 a month. But he says it is worth it as he pursues his goal to be an umpire in the major leagues.

headline.seo: On the Long Road, Committed to a Goal of Officiating in the Major Leagues
headline.main: Johns Hopkins Graduate, and an Umpire
headline.print_headline: Johns Hopkins Graduate, and an Umpire
